meanings.definition: To impose oneself upon others for food or lodging without payment.
meanings.sent1: He sorns off his friends by always staying over without asking.
meanings.sent2: She sorns off her family by constantly eating their food without contributing.
meanings.sent3: The cat sorns off the neighbors by sneaking into their house for extra meals.
meanings.sent4: The lazy raccoon sorns off the campers, stealing their snacks at night.
meanings.sent5: The clever fox sorns off the farmer, pretending to be a stray to get extra treats.

meanings.definition: To freeload or mooch off of others.
meanings.sent1: They sorns off their roommates by never buying groceries.
meanings.sent2: He always sorns off his coworkers for rides to work.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel sorns off the birds, stealing their seeds.
meanings.sent4: The seagull sorns off the beachgoers, waiting for them to drop food.
meanings.sent5: The stray cat sorns off the kind old lady, meowing for extra meals.

meanings.definition: To sponge off of someone else.
meanings.sent1: She sorns off her siblings by borrowing money and never paying it back.
meanings.sent2: He sorns off his friends by always asking for favors but never returning them.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon sorns off the campers, stealing their snacks when they're not looking.
meanings.sent4: The stray dog sorns off the park visitors, begging for scraps of food.
meanings.sent5: The clever fox sorns off the farmer, pretending to be lost to get free meals.
